title: Man injured as 2 groups clash in Tripura’s Kailashahar over government tenders; FIR registered
text:
The police registered the case under Bharatiya Nyaya Sanhita sections related to voluntarily causing hurt by dangerous weapons, committing robbery, criminal intimidation, common intention, criminal conspiracy, etc. (Source: File)

At least one man was injured as two local groups clashed allegedly over government tenders at Kailashahar in Tripura’s Unakoti district on Tuesday, the police said. Gunshots were fired into the air from unidentified firearms during the clash.

“A case was registered in this regard against eight people today. No one has been arrested till now,” a police officer said on Wednesday.
